channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Protests turn violent in Chicago as George Floyd demonstrations erupt across the nation
item.description: Crowds of thousands gathered in the Harlem section of Manhattan, Philadelphia, Chicago and at least 35 other cities on Saturday afternoon, chanting slogans and listening to speeches.

item.title: George Floyd protests: Woman arrested for attempted murder
item.description: Samantha Shader, 27, is accused of throwing the petrol bomb at the NYPD vehicle - which had four officers inside - in Crown Heights , NYC, shortly after 10.30pm.

item.title: Black Lives Matter protesters take to the streets of London
item.description: Buses and cars travelling along Rye Lane in Peckham were forced to a standstill this afternoon as hundreds of Black Lives Matter protesters marched along the main road.

item.title: Healing the rift between the Princes: The ex-Guards officer with the toughest peacekeeping mission
item.description: Misunderstandings, perceived snubs and pettiness caused a tragic rift between the once-close brothers. Former Welsh Guards officer Mark Dyer is now acting as a go-between.

item.title: Boris puts Dominic Cummings on his 'last chance' as one witness admits he made up sighting of aide
item.description: Boris Johnson has issued a stern rebuke to his aide Dominic Cummings, warning that he 'will not tolerate' another media firestorm after his chief aide's trip to Durham.

item.title: Donald Trump doubles down on blaming the 'radical left and ANTIFA' for George Floyd protests
item.description: Trump blasted what he called the 'rioters, looters and anarchists' that have taken to the streets of at least 30 cities this week to demand justice over Floyd's death.

item.title: Harry and Meghan 'hire LA security firm that charges up to Â£7,000 per day'
item.description: The couple, who are now living in Los Angeles with their son Archie, are using the firm also used by a slew of A-listers, including Jeff Bezos and Tom Hanks.

item.title: Michael Angelis dead aged 68: Long-term narrator ofÂ Thomas the Tank Engine series passes away
item.description: Michael Angelis, the longtime narrator forÂ Thomas the Tank Engine seriesÂ Thomas & Friends, died at his home aged 68 on Saturday, his agents confirmed.

item.title: Adele's weight loss 'was a result of low-calorie meal deals delivered directly to her door'
item.description: It is thought that the singer, 32, enlisted the services of a bespoke American meal delivery service called Freshology to help her with her transformation.

item.title: Assassin who killed 23 for Basque separatists Eta is now working for the RED CROSS, says her mother
item.description: Idoia Lopez Riano (pictured) became the world's most wanted female assassin in the 1980s while carrying out atrocities for Eta, the Basque separatist group.

item.title: DAN HODGES: The two other casualties of the coronavirus crisis... our humanity and the truthÂ
item.description: DAN HODGES: This is the prevailing distorted mindset. To take your ill child to hospital is a crime. One punishable by summary justice at the hands of the self-styled Covid vigilantes.

item.title: Coronavirus lockdown to be eased for 2.2million vulnerable people shielding since March
item.description: Families across England will finally be able to see their elderly relatives again tomorrow, as millions of vulnerable people 'shielding' are allowed to spend time outdoors as the lockdown is eased.

item.title: UK announces 215 more Covid-19 deaths, taking the number of victims to 38,376
item.description: Culture SecretaryÂ Oliver Dowden announced the figure tonight at Downing Street's daily press conference. It marks the lowest Saturday total since March 21, when 56 deaths were recorded.

item.title: Grieving dentist sues Matt Hancock over his father's death from Covid-19
item.description: Dr Minesh Talati launched the legal action after his 80-year-old father Navin succumbed to the disease at the Royal London Hospital after battling it for 28 days.

item.title: 'Don't tear the pants out of it!' Government adviser Prof Van-Tam warns not to abuse liberties
item.description: England's deputy chief medical officer Professor Jonathan Van Tam gave his colourful instruction as sun-seekers jumped the gun on Monday's easing of restrictions and crowded on to the nation's beaches.

item.title: Knife anarchy returns to streets of London as three people are stabbed near Hyde Park
item.description: Footage shows three armed police officers rushing through lanes of traffic towards Marble Arch station after a stabbing. Police confirmed that three people were stabbed and nobody was injured.

item.title: Britain abandoned Covid test and track because officials could only handle FIVE cases per week
item.description: Documents from the Sage advisory committee reveal that routine testing and tracing of contacts of people with the virus was stopped because Public Health England was facing a shortage of capacity.

item.title: Police want to talk to owner of drone who may have captured footage of angler before he died
item.description: Police want to talk to the owner of a drone who may have captured footage of two yobs throwing stones at angler Charlie Hilder, 66, before he died on Thursday in Eysnford, Kent.

item.title: Beijing now admits that coronavirus DIDN'T start in Wuhan's market... so where DID it come from
item.description: Gao Fu has admitted no viruses were detected in animal samples. He said they were found only in environmental samples, including sewage.

item.title: Mobility data shows Britons are flocking to parks to socialise in the warm weather as lockdown eases
item.description: There has been an 136% increase in the amount of people socialising in parks when compared to a baseline figure from before lockdown, according to new mobility data.

item.title: Boris Johnson urges EU leaders to speed up Brexit talks amid fears they are running down the clock
item.description: Boris Johnson has told EU leaders they have until September to strike a deal. The Prime Minister warned that delays from Brussels will not persuade the UK to extend the transition period past December 31.

item.title: Manchester City's Riyad Mahrez becomes the latest Premier League star to be targeted by thieves
item.description: The Â£500,000 haul included a prized Richard Mille timepiece similar to one that knife thugs snatched from England's Dele Alli two weeks ago. Raiders ceased Mahrez's luxury block.

item.title: Peers to be paid 'Â£160 just for clicking a button' under House of Lords remote-voting plans
item.description: Peers, who unlike MPs are not being encouraged to return to Westminster after Whitsun, would get Â£162 - half their usual daily allowance - for voting online.

item.title: PETER HITCHENS: Sack Dominic Cummings? Only if you want a LONGER lockdownÂ
item.description: PETER HITCHENS: Why would you want him sacked? If he is dismissed, then he won't suffer. He'll walk into a better paid job in the private sector. What good will that do you?

item.title: Queen 'will pay off Prince Andrew's Â£6.7million debt on French chalet' after threats to go to court
item.description: Her Majesty will end the the Duke and Duchess of York's feud with Isabelle de Rouvre, it is claimed. They are said to owe her Â£6.7m for theÂ Verbier chalet sold to them for Â£18million in 2014.

item.title: Ryanair boss warns most Britons will ignore 'useless' 14-day quarantine rules when arriving in UK
item.description: Most Britons will simply ignore 'unimplementable' new quarantine rules for travellers arriving in the UK, the boss of Ryanair has said. Michael O'Leary has called the policy 'useless'.

item.title: Ministers must speed up testing or risk contact tracing falling 'dead in the water', warn doctorsÂ
item.description: Currently almost half of test results are failing to come back within 48 hours, leaving the new army of 25,000 tracers racing to get in touch with contacts of newly confirmed cases in time.

item.title: Why Henry VIII was king of the lockdown, reveals author Dame Hilary Mantel
item.description: Author Dame Hilary Mantel (pictured) believes that life in a crisis under King Henry VIII and Thomas Cromwell would have been even tougher.

item.title: How story that sparked a week of national rage was fuelled by fake news
item.description: The Dominic Cummings furore began with an untruth. 'Police spoke to Cummings about lockdown breach' declared The Guardian's front page headline on May 23.

item.title: Only a fifth of state-school pupils work for 20 hours a week during lockdown lessons
item.description: When asked to characterise the effect lockdown has had on their child's education, the majority of parents of pupils at all types of schools agreed that it had been damaging.

item.title: Italian 'orange vest' protesters take to the streets of Rome and Milan
item.description: The orange vest protestors, led by ex-general Antonio Pappalardo, ignored social distancing rules and did not wear masks as they protested against Italy's coronavirus lockdown.

item.title: Remainer peer passed on information to help expose Dominic Cummings alleged Covid-19 breach
item.description: Former Durham MP Hilary Armstrong is being feted by Labour colleagues for her role in revealing that the No 10 aide had travelled 260 miles from his London home.
item.media:credit: BBC News & Current Affairs via G

item.title: Hot summer could curb the spread of Covid-19, says top epidemiologistÂ
item.description: A long, hot summer could help curb the spread of Covid-19, according to a top epidemiologist. Some virus particles were spread in specks of water that would evaporate in sunny weather.

item.title: Cabinet minister accused of bias in Â£1billion planning row
item.description: Housing Secretary Robert Jenrick last night admitted that tycoon Richard Desmond and his team raised the subject of their 1,500-home planning application with him at a fundraiser.

item.title: ROBERT DINGWALL: Why are we the only country obsessed with the disastrous two-metre rule?Â
item.description: ROBERT DINGWALL: Why have we been told that we must keep two metres from others to stop the spread of coronavirus? Why not one metre? Or three, for that matter?

item.title: Jamie Oliver pleads with PM not to 'open floodgates' to US - as poll reveals public fears on US meat
item.description: An overwhelming majority of Britons oppose moves to ditch animal welfare and environmental rules as part of any new trade deal with the United States, an exclusive Mail on Sunday poll has found.

item.title: HARRY COLE: Cabinet Secretary Sir Mark Sedwill went to a Katherine Jenkins gig on election night
item.description: Katherine Jenkins concert freebies racked up by oh-so grand Cabinet Secretary Sir Mark Sedwill suggest he was convinced Boris Johnson was going to win December's General Election.

item.title: Tom Watson is accused of 'lobbying by tweet for pal's Â£60,000 music job'
item.description: Critics of former Labour deputy leader Tom Watson have accused him of 'lobbying' for a lucrative music industry job before the post had been formally advertised, beating 79 other applicants.

item.title: Labour MP Rosie Duffield stands down as whip after breaking coronavirus lockdown rules
item.description: Rosie Duffield (pictured) admitted breaching coronavirus restrictions by meeting TV director James Routh before he moved in with her.

item.title: Phil Vickery brings out a timely cookbook as those with diabetes more likely to die of coronavirus
item.description: Diabetes Meal Planner, which provides healthy, balanced recipes for anyone living with diabetes. All the recipes have been approved by Diabetes UK

item.title: The 90 minutes when Hitler came closest to winning WWII
item.description: TIM BOUVERIE: Without the belligerency of Great Britain - fighting in North Africa and at sea, restricting supplies and bombing German cities - Germany would have been exponentially stronger.

item.title: Ryanair to cut fares by HALF in war on rivals
item.description: Boss O'Leary declared he is launching a 'pile them high, sell them cheap' sales blitz to lure passengers as he gobbles up flight routes vacated by other airlines.

item.title: Jeremy Hunt accused of plotting against Prime Minister after criticising delays on strategy
item.description: Jeremy Hunt (pictured) grilled the Prime Minister during a televised parliamentary hearing on why it had taken until April to introduce a 100,000-a-day tests target.

item.title: In The Last Dance Michael Jordan was a winner but as an owner he is anything but
item.description: Michael Jordan's win-at-all-costs mentality doesn't seem to have transferred from his playing days with the Chicago Bulls, as seen in 'The Last Dance', to the boardroom as owner of the Charlotte Hornets.

item.title: Councils to get power to fine drivers Â£130 for minor offences
item.description: Motorists in England face new automatic Â£130 fines imposed by cash-hungry councils under Government plans to give priority to cyclists and pedestrians after the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: Surprise! Mob hurling abuse at Dominic Cummings outside his family home in London were Remainers
item.description: The Mail on Sunday can reveal that in addition to a shared desire to 'hold Dominic Cummings to account', those hurling abuse appeared united by another cause: antipathy towards Brexit.

item.title: Duchess of Cornwall has ELEVEN pairs of bunion-busting shoes
item.description: For generations, the price of the traditional Royal walkabout has been the painful toll they take on regal feet.

item.title: Air ambulances land at Durdle Door after three people hurt themselves jumping off cliff
item.description: The four unidentified jumpers vaulted from the top of the ancient limestone arch, known as Durdle Door in Dorset, which reaches 200ft at its highest point.

item.title: 1,000 customers queue for a trim on waiting lists at Britain's top hair salons
item.description: Toni & Guy has 1,000 clients on the waiting list at its branch in Sloane Square, Chelsea; 800 at Wimbledon; and even 300 at East Grinstead.

item.title: Elton John lays off staff and bandmates after taking a Â£60m hit
item.description: The Mail on Sunday can reveal that the singer and partner David Furnish have been left 'bereft' as they had anticipated the cash would see him into his retirement.

item.title: Internal emails show Facebook employees wanted to remove Trump's 'looting and shooting' tweets
item.description: Facebook employees have been voicing their concern after the site left a couple of controversial Twitter posts by President Trump up on its site. The president posted to both Twitter and Facebook.

item.title: TALK OF THE TOWN: Karen Millen forced to sell her Â£2.5 million home after being declared bankruptÂ
item.description: TALK OF THE TOWN: The 58-year-old, pictured left, whose empire once boasted 400 eponymous shops in 65 countries, has downsized from the home in Kent, pictured right, that was her 'pride and joy'.

item.title: 15 terrorists in British jails have refused to take part in deradicalisation scheme since 2018Â
item.description: Convicted terrorists are snubbing a flagship deradicalisation scheme intended to wean them off extremism, The Mail on Sunday can reveal. 15 have refused to do so since January 2018.

item.title: Excited Britons try to catch a glimpse of Elon Musk's SpaceX rocket
item.description: The rocket and the International Space Station passed over the UK near 10.15pm this evening, with excited stargazers flocking to take photos and video.

item.title: NASA and Elon Musk's SpaceX successfully launch Falcon 9
item.description: NASA and Elon Musk's SpaceX have brought spaceflight back to US with the successful launch of the Falcon 9 rocket from Kennedy Space Center to the International Space Station.

item.title: Fox News crew are chased by angry mob who 'doused them with water and tried to steal their camera'
item.description: Leland Vittert claims he was attacked by a crowd around 1am on Saturday as he reported from the White House, Washingtin DC. Vittert and his crew fled the scene.

item.title: Atlanta officer stuns crowd protesting George Floyd's death with his sympathy
item.description: Officer Z. Murphy told protestors in Atlanta, Georgia, they had a right to be 'p***** off' over the death of 46-year-old George Floyd

item.title: Met Police are accused of surrendering to criminals by 'backing off' in lawless area of London
item.description: Police chiefs have been accused of surrendering to criminals in a lawless area of London after tensions rose after a subject was tasered as he jumped over a wall and suffered serious injuries.

item.title: UK 'warned Pope John Paul II of assassination plot' - two years before he was targeted by a gunman
item.description: British spies warned Pope John Paul II that he was in danger of being murdered by an assassin using a poison-tipped umbrella - two years before he was attacked by a gunman, it is claimed.

item.title: Kate and William to sue Tatler over 'cruel, sexist and woman-shaming' article
item.description: In a highly unusual move, the couple have sent legal letters to the magazine demanding its profile of the Duchess - headlined 'Catherine the Great' - be removed from the internet.

item.title: TALK OF THE TOWN: Family who helped find tomb of Tutankhamun snubbed by Â£1 billion gala
item.description: TALK OF THE TOWN: The great-grandfather of Lord Carnarvon funded the discovery of the tomb of the Pharaoh but the family were not invited to the Grand Egyptian Museum opening

item.title: ALEXANDRA SHULMAN'S NOTEBOOK: Why being posh no longer means mud and clutterÂ
item.description: ALEXANDRA SHULMAN: 'Very Buckinghamshire'. It's how one snobbish commentator described the interiors of the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge's country home.

item.title: Ex-MP Norman Baker argues we must hit back against China that has contempt for our way of life
item.description: China do not play by the same rules as other countries. They play dirty.Â It despises democracy and wants to see it replaced as the natural form of government.

item.title: George Floyd protests: Trump blames 'radical left' for violence
item.description: 'Last night is a mockery of pretending that this is about George Floyd's death, or inequities, or historical traumas to our communities of color,' Governor Tim Walz said on Saturday.

item.title: US megafarm locals call 'Cowschwitz' has 120,000 cattle pumped with hormones to boost growth
item.description: Harris Ranch in California (pictured) is one of America's largest 'feedlots', or factory farms for cows, and produces a staggering 150 million pounds of beef every year.

item.title: Influencer Ashley Stock reveals daughter, Stevie, three, has died from very rare brain cancer
item.description: Stevie Lynn Stock, the three-year-old daughter of social media influencer, Ashley Stock, has died following a six-week battle with a very rare brain cancer.

item.title: JAMIE OLIVER joins Mail on Sunday's campaign to save family farms with open letter to PMÂ
item.description: I write this letter because I believe you're about to seriously undermine public health and unpick the delicate patchwork quilt of farmers and food producers who are the backbone of this country.

item.title: 'Saviour' of Africa's wildlife is revealed as cold-hearted killer in gun video
item.description: As a pride of lions took their first tentative steps into their new habitat, Ivan Carter, TV presenter and safari guide, proudly whispered to the camera: 'This is the front line of conservation.'

item.title: DR ELLIE CANNON: Don't be one of the 80 per cent of men who'd rather be ill than admit to a problem
item.description: DR ELLIE CANNON offers her guide to dealing with the male ailments you might be shy to talk about - but really needn't be, pictured.

item.title: Scientists identify seven medicines including Xanax that could be used to block coronavirus
item.description: Researches from universities in Barcelona have been searching for existing drugs that can help block the virus by stopping it replicating in cells.

item.title: DR ELLIE CANNON answers your questions on coronavirus
item.description: DR ELLIE CANNON: The Mail on Sunday's GP discusses protecting vulnerable relatives, driving to other areas of the country, potential for another outbreak and more in this week's column

item.title: Hong Kong officials criticize Trump's decision to strip the city of its special status
item.description: Teresa Cheng, Hong Kong's justice minister, said the basis for Trump's actions was 'completely false and wrong', while security minister John Lee said he thinks Trump will fail in his plan.

item.title: Lockdown parents have faced 120 cries of 'I'm bored!'
item.description: If you've reached the end of your tether juggling work, home schooling and housework during lockdown, you're far from alone.

item.title: DR MICHAEL MOSLEY: Want to know how long you'll live? See how many of these you can do in one minute
item.description: DR MICHAEL MOSLEY: ItÂ sounds bizarre, but the length of time you are able to stand on one leg is a powerful predictor of how long you will live and how healthy you will be.

item.title: Jordan Henderson's plans for a Â£3million Cheshire mansion may be scuppered by GEESE
item.description: He hasÂ become accustomed to triumphing on the football field - but Liverpool captain Jordan Henderson is facing some unexpected opposition when it comes to building a Â£3 million mansion.

item.title: Itching, baldness and painful sex: The embarrassing questions that you're too shy to ask your GP
item.description: Surveys suggest that up to two-thirds of Britons avoid visiting their GP for conditions they consider embarrassing.

item.title: Outrage at Belgian prince as he catches coronavirus after attending an illegal party in Spain
item.description: Prince Joachim of Belgium, the nephew of the country's king, has been diagnosed with coronavirus just days after attending a private party in Spain which breached social distancing rules.Â

item.title: Trump defends his supporters after appearing to suggest they confront protesters outside White House
item.description: Donald Trump defended his supporters and declared 'MAGA loves the black people' after asking his followers whether it would be 'MAGA night at the White House'.

item.title: Boris Johnson warns Dominic Cummings that he can't afford to become the story again
item.description: Downing Street sources have told this newspaper a furious Prime Minister warned that he would not tolerate another media firestorm concerning his eccentric right-hand man.

item.title: Left-wing writer and teacher at a top girls' school target Michael Gove's family on Twitter
item.description: Podcast host and former Daily Mirror and Guardian journalist Andy Dawson was questioned by officers over an aggressively foul-mouthed tweet he sent to Mr Gove's wife Sarah Vine.

item.title: Iran stalls again over releasing 'deflated' British mother Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe back to the UK
item.description: Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe (pictured) is said to be 'deflated' after a decision on whether to grant her freedom, which was expected yesterday, was postponed a second time.

item.title: How Netflix drama Hollywood makes a mockery of Rock Hudson
item.description: The chiselled jaw and rugged good looks are instantly recognisable. As screen legend Rock Hudson walks along the red carpet for the Oscars in 1948, hand-in-hand with his black male lover.

item.title: WHO investigates Meghan's China TV friend over airing of 'forced confession' of British businessman
item.description: James Chau, a British journalist who rose to stardom on China's state television, is being investigated by the World Health Organisation over his role as one of its celebrity ambassadors.

item.title: Man caught swimming in 'toxic' blue lagoon that was dyed black by Derbyshire police
item.description: The 'blue lagoon' in Derbyshire is full of harmful chemicals that can cause skin irritations, with the water reportedly having the same PH value as bleach.

item.title: ANDREW ROBERTS: The Left hate and fear Dominic Cummings
item.description: Outside the home of its intended victim, its yelling reporters and snapping photographers ignore social distancing in their excitement, even though the story is, ironically, about social distancing.

item.title: Proof of Prince Andrew's 'alibi' for the Virginia Roberts incident lie in a Sidcup police office
item.description: Documents that could make or break Prince Andrew's 'alibi' for the night he is alleged to have had sex with a sex-trafficked teenager are gathering dust in a police office.

item.title: Hundreds of IRA terrorists may have their convictions quashed following Supreme Court ruling
item.description: Hundreds of IRA terrorists could have their convictions quashed after the Supreme Court upheld a complaint from former IRA man turned Sinn Fein president Gerry Adams, legal experts have warned.

item.title: Lifeline for bowel cancer patients as experts hail game-changing breakthrough drug
item.description: Diane Reynolds, from Peterborough, pictured, is one of those to benefit from pembrolizumab, which helps the body attack and kill cancer cells.

item.title: Why won't the NHS test for the heart attack gene 200,000 of us don't even know we have?
item.description: Familial hypercholesterolaemia is often symptomless, but if untreated, patients can die before reaching middle age or even as children, like Rianna Wingett from Essex, pictured.

item.title: Eight-month-old baby's skin turned red after getting Kawasaki-like disease linked to coronavirus
item.description: Elle Adams, 40, from Tameside, Manchester, phoned 111 after her son Lewis, came up in red rash across entire body. He was sent to Royal Manchester Children's Hospital for specialist treatment.

item.title: Michelle Obama says she is 'pained' and 'exhausted' by George Floyd's killing
item.description: Michelle Obama shared an Instagram post on Friday saying she was 'pained' by the recent string of tragedies in the black community and the 'heartbreak that never seems to stop.'

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg explains why Facebook left up Trump's controversial 'looting and shooting' post
item.description: Trump initially shared the post to both Twitter and Facebook at 1am Friday following a third night of violent protests in Minnesota over the death of black man George Floyd.

item.title: Ministers green light return of professional competitive sport in England from June 1
item.description: Ministers today gave the green light for the return of professional competitive sport in England from June 1, with horse racing and Premier League football likely to be the first back.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Christian leaders says mass closure of churches is 'unlawful'
item.description: A coalition of Christian bishops and reverends in Britain has urged the Government to prioritise churches in its exit strategy from the coronavirus lockdown.

item.title: Man, 56, is charged with 'explosives offences'
item.description: A 52-year-old man has been charged with an explosives offence after a police search at a house in the Anfield area of Liverpool.

item.title: Police find guests staying at five-star hotel in County Durham despite lockdown rules
item.description: Police in County Durham discovered guests were staying at the five-star, Â£850-per-night Ramside Hall Treehouse hotel despite coronavirus lockdown rules forbidding overnight stays.

item.title: How to swap your skincare regime from spring to summer, according to a dermatologist
item.description: Hotter temperatures and drier air inevitably has an impact on our skin. Here Dr Murad, a board certified dermatologist and founder of Murad Skincare, shares his top tips for changing up your skincare routine.

item.title: Isle of Sheppey homes evacuated after cliff collapse leaves house 'hanging' over the edge
item.description: Groups of residents on the Isle of Sheppey had to be evacuated from their homes after a cliff suddenly collapsed on Friday night, sparking fears of a collapse into the murky waters below.

item.title: Rightmove records its busiest EVER day with six million visits
item.description: The biggest jump in buyer interest on Rightmove compared to last year was seen in Canterbury, Kent, while coastal areas of Cornwall, Devon and Dorset were also popular.

item.title: Billionaire builds Â£280million superyacht with eight laboratories and submarine for scientists
item.description: Norwegian billionaireÂ Kjell Inge Rokke is using his bottomless reserves to give something back, after overseeing the creation of a Â£280million superyacht which will be intermittently offered to scientists.

item.title: Couple are isolating on idyllic uninhabited Bahamas island with nine-month-baby
item.description: Captain Brian Trautman, from the US, and his wife Karin, live aboard their boat SV Delos and told BBC World Service they may soon be forced to leave the Bahamas due to hurricane season.

item.title: It's harder than it looks! Women reveal the WORST things about motherhood
item.description: Women from around the globe took to the anonymous sharing app Whisper to candidly reveal the aspects of motherhood they dislike the most.

item.title: Police say no one spat at train ticket inspector who died of coronavirus
item.description: Belly Mujinga died in April aged 47 of Covid-19, a few weeks after a passenger spat at her in London's Victoria Station. Detectives said they were taking 'no further action' after no evidence of spitting found.

item.title: Jeremy Corbyn's activist brother Piers is arrested yet AGAIN
item.description: The brother of Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn was photographed this afternoon being taken away by two police officers who were wearing face masks.

item.title: Groups of six allowed to exercise outdoors together in England from Monday
item.description: Groups of up to six people from different households will be allowed to exercise together outdoors in England from Monday - as long as they stay two metres apart.

item.title: Microsoft will axe up to 50 journalists and replace them with robots
item.description: In Britain, the Californian-based company has a contract with PA Media to supply curators whose job it is to update the company's homepage on its MSN website and Edge browser.

item.title: Piers Morgan declared that the coronavirus pandemic has put celebrities 'firmly back in their box'
item.description: The Good Morning Britain host, 55, declared that the coronavirus pandemic has put celebrities 'firmly back in their box' as he branded Prince Harry and Meghan Markle 'utterly irrelevant'.

item.title: Man fighting for life after gunman shot him 'eight times' in front of his terrified girlfriend
item.description: The gunman forced his way into the man's house on Friday, and neighbours described hearing up to eight shots fired. Police are hunting the shooter who fled the scene and remains on the run.

item.title: Man, 32, is charged with attempted murder after horror knife attack at home
item.description: A man has been charged with attempted murder following a double stabbing that has left a woman and her seven-month-old baby in Tipton, West Midlands.

item.title: David and Victoria Beckham 'plan to build a secret getaway tunnel from their Cotswolds pad'
item.description: David and Victoria Beckham are reportedly amping up their security at their Cotswolds home by building a secret getaway tunnel.

item.title: Mother-of-seven says boozy nights with pals are more important than getting kids to school on time
item.description: The mummy blogger, 36, from Perth, Australia, shared a lengthy post on Facebook advocating taking some time out to relax rather than worrying about making sure the house is in order.

item.title: Russian manicurist's bizarre barbeque design featuring kebabs roasting over an open FIRE goes viral
item.description: Russian beauty salon Nail Sunny, has divided its Instagram fans after sharing footage of its latest nail art design, which features mini shish kebabs cooking over a tiny BBQ with real flames.

item.title: Heartwarming moment boyfriend proposes to his NHS nurse girlfriend during the Clap for Carers
item.description: Jamie Carlton, 27, popped the question to his girlfriend Lauren McAulay, 26, while they stood clapping for key workers outside their house in Corby, Northamptonshire.

item.title: Mother considers returning to webcam modelling after having her hours cut at work
item.description: An anonymous woman from the UK told Mumsnet she's considering webcam modelling because her hours have been cut at work. The 'radical feminist' explained she needs the money for her child.

item.title: Shocking moment dozens of teenagers brawl at Lincolnshire beauty spot during lockdownÂ
item.description: Video footage circulating online shows the youths at Stamford meadowsÂ between the millstream and the River Welland.

item.title: British ticketholder scoops Â£15.2million EuroMillions jackpot
item.description: The winner of Friday's jackpot comes days after another UK EuroMillions player netted Â£16.5 million after sharing the main prize from Tuesday's game with a ticket-holder in France.

item.title: Doorknobs, handrails and shopping trolleys should be coated in copper to prevent spread of Covid-19
item.description: Covid-19 can survive and remain contagious on steel and plastic for up to three days. Professor William Keevil, from Southampton University, said copper's antibacterial properties help it kill the virus rapidly.

item.title: Thrifty mother transforms her hallway for just Â£23 by WALLPAPERING her floor
item.description: Robyn Westrope-lane, from Huntingdon, told how she was after a temporary solution while she saved up enough money to replace her beige flooring, so she wallpapered her hallway.

item.title: People shared adorable snaps of foxes and their cubs breaking into their garden
item.description: Cheeky foxes from around the world were seen to make the most of their surroundings by taking a well-earned nap on rooftops and playing with leftover toys in back gardens.

item.title: Piers Morgan confirms he's signed a new contract to REMAIN on Good Morning Britain until 2021
item.description: The broadcaster, 55, confirmed he's signed a new contract that will see him remain on Good Morning Britain until 2021 and insisted that he 'doesn't care' about complaints over his style.

item.title: Nursery teacher, 18, is mocked after asking where the wax in her candle had gone when she burnt it
item.description: Charlotte Heckermann, 21,Â from Manchester, bought her sister Ami a scented wax melting pot and gave her a tealight to burn to release the scent - but Ami was left 'confused' when the wax melted.

item.title: Shocking moment learner scooter driver uses PAVEMENT to overtake carÂ
item.description: This is the shocking moment a learner scooter driver uses the pavement to overtake a car as captured by dashcam footage.

item.title: George Floyd death: Family say autopsy results are an 'illusion'
item.description: The preliminaryÂ results of Tuesday's autopsy on the body of George Floyd, 46, concluded it saw 'no physical findings that support a diagnosis of traumatic asphyxiation or strangulation'.

item.title: Police hunt 'canal pusher' gang after pregnant woman and teenage boys were shoved into water
item.description: The two 14-year-old boys, Ryan and Jake (not their real names), were set upon by the gang as they walked along Netherton Canal in Liverpool at 6.50pm on Tuesday. Pictured, Ryan's wound.

item.title: Alan Johnson: Teaching unions 'got it wrong' over reopening schools
item.description: Former Labour education secretary Alan Johnson has told union chiefs they 'got it wrong' by opposing the phased reopening of schools as he urged them to now end their 'war dance'.

item.title: Durham chief constable faces probe into her handling of investigation into Dominic Cummings' trip
item.description: Durham Police received complaints over the handling of the investigation into Dominic Cummings. A portion are understood to have been made against Chief Constable Jo Farrell.

item.title: Endangered elvers make a dramatic return to British waters
item.description: Experts say this year's stock in the River Severn as the biggest for decades. Heavy rain earlier this year has led to a rise in the warm freshwater that the eels like.

item.title: Theresa May criticises Dominic Cummings's lockdown actions
item.description: The former Prime Minister said in a letter to her Maidenhead constituents that her successor Boris Johnson's senior aide had broke the 'spirit' of the lockdown rules.

item.title: Wartime cover star known as the 'girl with the tractor', now aged 100, tells her extraordinary story
item.description: The 'girl with the tractor' is revealed as Patricia Fack, a former debutante who went on to marry a Dutch diplomat. For almost 80 years, few have known the identity of the Women's Land Army recruit.

item.title: BBC receives 40,000 complaints in just two days after Emily Maitlis sparks impartiality row
item.description: Some viewers have been incensed at what they see as the BBC Two show's bias against Mr Cummings and the Government, while others have been enraged by the corporation's rapid climbdown.

item.title: How 'Zoom fatigue' can lead to burnout and depression
item.description: Named after the popular video chatting platform, Zoom fatigueÂ is used to describe the exhaustion that comes with participating in video conferences.

item.title: Ex-footballer gets excited about Premier League's return as he tots up number of games in a weekÂ
item.description: Solihull Moors forward Jake Beesley shared a video of his dad, ex-footballer Paul Beesley, counting how many matches he will be able to watch at their home in Dronfield, Derbyshire.

item.title: Friends, flowers and foolproof pastry
item.description: British garden designer Jo Thompson and cook Mary Jane Paterson have penned a new book offering their expert cooking and gardening advice.

item.title: Arsenal's away shirt for 2020-21 compared to Patrick Bateman's blood-spattered American Psycho coat
item.description: Arsenal's away kit for the 2020-2021 season has been leaked online, with fans quick to criticise the design. The marble print has been compared to raspberry ripple ice cream and a butcher's coat.
